newsitem.title: USA: Novell Chairman Robert Frankenberg resigns.
newsitem.headline: Novell Chairman Robert Frankenberg resigns.

text.p: Novell Inc. said Thursday that Robert Frankenberg resigned as chairman, president and chief executive officer.
Novell, a provider of network software, said John Young, a past president and CEO of Hewlett-Packard Co., would succeed Frankenberg as chairman.
The company gave no reason for Frankenberg's resignation.
Joseph Marengi, Novell's executive vice president of worldwide sales, was named president.
Novell said it had begun a search for a new chief executive.
Young, who is 64, was president and CEO of Hewlett-Packard for 15 years through 1992. He joined Novell's board in January 1995.
Novell said Young would be actively involved in overseeing management of the company until the appointment of a new chief executive.
Frankenberg joined Novell as president and CEO in April 1994 and was named chairman in August of that year.
He headed Novell during a period marked by the acquisition and then sale of the popular WordPerfect software and the refocus of the company to its position of leadership in network software.
Novell's stock lost 50 cents to $10.50 in late morning trading on the Nasdaq market.
